tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]]

tn.ref: Pashhur
tn.text: This is not the same Pashhur that was mentioned in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:20:01|20:1]]

tn.ref: Seek advice from Yahweh on our behalf
tn.text: AT: "Please speak to Yahweh for us. Ask him if he will help us"

tn.ref: as in times past
tn.text: AT: "as he did in the past" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: will make him withdraw from us
tn.text: AT: "will make him go away"

tn.ref: the instruments of war that are in your hand
tn.text: AT: "the soldiers that you command" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: closing you in
tn.text: "coming close to you"

tn.ref: with a raised hand and a strong arm
tn.text: Both of these phrases are idiomatic expressions that refer to great power. AT: "with very great power." (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: with wrath, fury, and great anger
tn.text: These words all mean basically the same thing. Together they emphasize the great intensity of his anger. AT: "with extremely great anger." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_doublet]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]]

tn.ref: inhabitants of this city
tn.text: AT: "those who live in Jerusalem"

tn.ref: this people
tn.text: AT: "the people of Jerusalem"

tn.ref: I am about to place before you the way of life and the way of death
tn.text: Yahweh is offering the people of Jerusalem a choice that will determine whether they live or die.

tn.ref: falling on his knees before
tn.text: AT: "surrendering to"

tn.ref: closed in against
tn.text: AT: "attacked from all sides"

tn.ref: I have set my face against
tn.text: AT: "I have determined to oppose" or "I have turned against"

tn.ref: He will escape with his life
tn.text: The one who surrenders to the Babylonians will escape with his life, even though he will lose all his possessions.

tn.ref: this is Yahweh's declaration
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:01:07|1:8]].

tn.ref: Concerning the house of the king of Judah, listen to the word of Yahweh
tn.text: AT: "Listen to what Yahweh says about the king of Judah, his family, and his servants."

tn.ref: Bring about justice in the morning
tn.text: AT: "Always treat the people whom you rule over fairly" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: the hand of the oppressor
tn.text: AT: "the power of the one who oppresses" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: my fury will go out like fire and burn
tn.text: AT: "I will punish and destroy you in my anger quickly and completely" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: I am against you, rock of the plain
tn.text: AT: "I oppose you, Jerusalem" or "I am going to punish you, people of Jerusalem" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: this is Yahweh's declaration
tn.text: See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:jer:01:07|1:8]].

tn.ref: Who will come down to attack us? ... Who will enter our houses?
tn.text: AT: "No one will attack us and no one will enter our houses" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_rquestion]])

tn.ref: I have assigned the fruit of your practices to come against you
tn.text: AT: "I will punish you as you deserve because of the things you have done" See: ([[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: the fruit of your practices
tn.text: AT: "the result of your deeds" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
